item.title: 杰夫·柯里谈金属价格的疯狂飙升，以及超级周期为何仍将持续数年
item.description:
关于银价飙升的解释。

【原文：

An Explanation for the Silver Surge.

】

item.title: 零散股：杰夫·柯里谈金属价格的疯狂飙升（播客）
item.description: 零散股：杰夫·柯里谈金属价格的疯狂飙升（播客）【原文：Odd Lots: Jeff Currie on the Crazy Surge in Metals (Podcast)】

item.title: 日本商界领袖呼吁政府在外汇领域采取更多行动
item.description: 日本一家代表中小企业的大型商业集团负责人呼吁日本政府在货币政策上采取更多行动，警告称日元疲软正挤压中小企业生存空间，并危及工资增长。【原文：The leader of one of Japan’s biggest business groups representing smaller firms called on the Japanese government to take more action on currencies, warning that the weak yen is squeezing smaller companies and putting wage hikes at risk.】

item.title: 印度债券借贷计划据称因税收不确定性受阻
item.description: 知情人士透露，尽管相关基础设施已建成逾18个月，印度允许主权债券借贷的计划仍因税收政策的不确定性而陷入停滞，这使得深化该国1.3万亿美元债券市场的努力变得复杂。【原文：India’s plan to allow lending and borrowing of sovereign bonds remains stalled by uncertainty on how taxes will be applied, despite infrastructure being in place for more than 18 months, according to people familiar with the matter, complicating an effort to deepen the nation’s $1.3 trillion debt market.】

item.title: 金银暴跌，美联储提名人选报道推升美元
item.description: 周五金银价格大幅下跌，终结了此前创纪录的涨势。特朗普政府拟提名凯文·沃什出任美联储主席的消息提振美元走强。【原文：Gold and silver sold off heavily on Friday, cooling a record-breaking rally, as a report the Trump administration is preparing to nominate Kevin Warsh for Federal Reserve chair boosted the dollar.】

item.title: 香港经济受出口和投资推动，创2021年以来最强劲增长
item.description: 在全球贸易战背景下，香港经济增长速度创下2021年以来最快纪录，这得益于出口意外强劲以及投资持续走高。【原文：Hong Kong’s economy grew at the fastest pace since 2021, buoyed by unexpectedly resilient exports amid a global trade war and strong investment.】

item.title: 中国黄金抗议活动揭露金属价格飙升背后的阴暗面
item.description: 一家小型黄金零售商和交易商门外的抗议活动，暴露了中国各地投机性购买造成的混乱程度——正是这种购买行为推动了创纪录的金属价格上涨。【原文：Protests outside the premises of a small gold retailer and trader have laid bare the extent of disruption caused by speculative buying across China that is powering a record-breaking metals rally.】

item.title: 比特币或将创下自2018年以来最长的月度连跌纪录
item.description: 比特币正面临近七年来最严重的月度连跌，因避险情绪加剧及传统避险资产的激烈竞争削弱了市场对该数字货币的需求。【原文：Bitcoin is heading for its worst streak of monthly losses in about seven years, as a deepening risk-off mood and fierce competition from traditional haven assets sap demand for the token.】

item.title: 新兴市场股市有望创三年来最佳月度表现，因前景改善
item.description: 新兴市场以与2025年末相似的态势开启新年，在发达经济体受财政与政策风险拖累之际，它们正吸引着全球关注与资本。【原文：Emerging markets are starting the year much as they ended 2025, drawing global attention and capital while fiscal and policy risks weigh on advanced economies.】

item.title: 捷克经济加速增长，强劲的家庭需求提供动力
item.description: 捷克共和国去年经济增长加速，主要得益于国内需求的推动——随着收入增长，家庭支出随之增加。【原文：Economic growth in the Czech Republic accelerated last year, driven mainly by domestic demand as households increased spending fueled by rising incomes.】

item.title: 台湾经济增速创1987年以来季度最高纪录，人工智能功不可没
item.description: 台湾经济增速创下1987年以来季度最高纪录，这主要得益于人工智能发展所需科技产品的强劲需求。【原文：Taiwan’s economy expanded at the quickest pace for a quarter since 1987, propelled by unquenchable demand for the tech goods needed to develop AI.】

item.title: 欧洲天然气价格在寒潮中创2023年以来最大月度涨幅
item.description: 欧洲天然气价格正朝着至少两年来的最大月度涨幅迈进，此前寒潮天气和燃料库存的急剧减少颠覆了市场情绪。【原文：European natural gas headed for its biggest monthly gain in at least two years after cold spells and a rapid depletion of fuel inventories upended market sentiment.】

item.title: 匈牙利GDP增速低于预期，工业产出下滑拖累经济增长
item.description: 数据显示，由于工业生产持续低迷，匈牙利去年第四季度经济增速低于预期。【原文：Hungary’s economy expanded less than expected in the final quarter of last year as a prolonged slump in industrial production persisted, data showed on Friday.】

item.title: 中国2025年财政支出目标未达预期，显现对债务的谨慎态度
item.description: 2025年中国政府支出连续第七年低于预算计划，这为经济面临压力时提供了更大的财政弹药。【原文：China’s government spending fell short of plans in the budget for the seventh straight year in 2025, giving Beijing more fiscal firepower if the economy comes under pressure.】

item.title: 印度航空坠机调查倾向于认定是飞行员蓄意行为
item.description: 据知情人士透露，印度对去年波音787客机坠毁事故的调查正日益将飞行员故意行为锁定为可能原因，这标志着此前对此持抵触态度的当局已有所让步。【原文：India’s probe into last year’s Boeing Co. 787 jet crash is increasingly homing in on deliberate pilot action as the probable cause, according to people familiar with the findings, marking a concession by authorities previously resistant to that scenario.】

item.title: 阿斯特拉与CSPC达成价值高达185亿美元的肥胖症合作协议
item.description: 阿斯利康公司与中国赛普斯制药集团达成一项价值高达185亿美元的减肥药合作协议，这家英国制药商正试图进军不断增长的减肥市场。【原文：AstraZeneca Plc agreed an obesity drug deal with Chinese company CSPC Pharmaceutical Group Ltd. worth up to $18.5 billion, as the British drugmaker tries to push into the growing weight-loss market.】

item.title: 百仕通以14亿欧元估值收购基金平台Carne股权
item.description: 私募股权公司百仕通已同意收购资产管理平台卡恩集团的重大少数股权，该交易对这家总部位于都柏林的企业估值达14亿欧元（17亿美元）。【原文：Private equity firm Permira agreed to buy a significant minority stake in asset management platform Carne Group in a deal that values the Dublin-based firm at €1.4 billion ($1.7 billion).】

item.title: 法国阻止欧卫通信出售战略资产，莱斯库尔称
item.description: 法国财政部长罗兰·莱斯库尔表示，他阻止了欧洲卫星公司出售一项战略资产，动用了国家权力对外国实体的投资进行审查和干预。【原文：French Finance Minister Roland Lescure said he blocked Eutelsat from selling a strategic asset, deploying the state’s powers to screen and intervene in investment from foreign entities.】

item.title: 铠侠在人工智能存储领域寻求增长，而竞争对手则追逐高带宽内存利润
item.description: 闪存制造商铠侠控股公司（Kioxia Holdings Corp.）正瞄准人工智能数据中心高密度存储领域的发展机遇，趁其竞争对手专注于其他领域之际抢占先机。【原文：Flash memory maker Kioxia Holdings Corp. sees an opportunity to seize growth in high-density storage for AI data centers while its competitors are preoccupied elsewhere.】

item.title: 就连英格兰银行也难以维持收支平衡
item.description: 英国央行行长安德鲁·贝利数月来一直警告称，英国企业可能开始裁员。如今这一趋势正出现在他自己的机构内部——随着央行为削减成本而启动全面重组，裁员浪潮已然显现。【原文：Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey has warned for months that UK firms may start to trim jobs. That trend’s now showing up under his own roof, as the bank embarks on a sweeping reorganization driven by the need to pare costs.】

item.title: 肯尼亚通胀放缓，但干旱导致食品价格飙升
item.description: 肯尼亚1月份通胀有所缓解，尽管干旱导致粮食产量下降，食品价格出现上涨。【原文：Kenyan inflation eased in January, even after food prices jumped as a drought curbs food production.】

item.title: 东京燃气股价上涨，因该公司上调了营业利润预期
item.description: 东京燃气公司周五股价大涨，此前该公司上调了本财年业绩预期。【原文：Tokyo Gas Co. jumped Friday after the firm boosted its fiscal year guidance.】

item.title: 美元走软推动小麦创2024年5月以来最大月度涨幅
item.description: 美元走软提升了美国小麦在海外市场的吸引力，推动美国小麦期货创下近两年来最大月度涨幅。【原文：US wheat futures headed for the biggest monthly advance in nearly two years as a weaker dollar improved the appeal of the crop abroad.】

item.title: 野村证券将回购股票，年度利润仍有望创纪录
item.description: 野村控股公司宣布计划回购股票，尽管其第三季度利润下滑，但这家日本最大券商仍有望实现创纪录的年度盈利。【原文：Nomura Holdings Inc. announced plans to buy back shares even after profit fell in the third quarter, as Japan’s biggest brokerage remained on course for record annual earnings.】

item.title: 英镑跌破1.38美元关口，富时100指数期货持稳
中国计划向最大保险公司注资290亿美元
item.description: 知情人士透露，中国正考虑发行数千亿元人民币的特别政府债券，为部分大型保险公司注资。此举将强化该行业中面临整合压力的主要参与者。【原文：China is mulling the sale of hundreds of billions of yuan in special government bonds to recapitalize some of its largest insurers, according to people familiar with the matter, strengthening the biggest players in a sector that is under pressure to consolidate.】

item.title: 南非股市创纪录月度涨势已超越金属板块
item.description: 南非股市正朝着创纪录的最长月度连涨纪录迈进，市场乐观情绪高涨，认为这场由大宗商品驱动的强劲涨势即将向其他板块蔓延。【原文：South African equities are on track for their longest monthly winning streak on record as optimism mounts that the powerful commodities-driven rally is poised to broaden out to other sectors.】

item.title: 伦敦股市遭冷落，英国养老金涌入私营企业
item.description: 英国固定收益养老金计划正大量涌入私营企业，其股权投资组合中近半数已由非上市股票构成，这给振兴伦敦金融城公开市场的努力带来冲击。【原文：UK defined benefit pension plans are piling into private companies with nearly half of their equity exposure now made up of unquoted shares, a knock to efforts to revitalize the City of London’s public markets.】

item.title: 法国经济持续增长，尽管政治和预算陷入混乱
item.description: 去年年底，法国经济持续增长，家庭消费者无视政治动荡和紧缩政策的风险。【原文：France’s economy kept growing at the end of last year as households shrugged off political upheaval and the risk of austerity.】

item.title: 南非货币政策委员会成员克里斯·洛瓦尔德将离任央行
item.description: 南非央行经济研究主管提前从该机构退休，此举将减少货币政策委员会的投票成员数量。【原文：The head of economic research at South Africa’s central bank is taking early retirement from the institution, reducing the number of voting members on the monetary policy committee.】
